definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: Taking time out from their heartbreak, they get back to nature.
sentences.chinese: 逐步從心碎的愛情中走出來後，他們復歸自然。

sentences.english: The depression was slackened off and prosperity was returning.
sentences.chinese: 蕭條漸趨緩和，繁榮正在復歸。

sentences.english: From death life emerges, in the end.
sentences.chinese: 生命從死亡中復歸，結局如是說。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the water column retractable -chuen, mouth, all reverted to calm.
sentences.chinese: 轉瞬間，水柱縮回泉口，一切復歸平靜。

sentences.english: Finally, we call for the rebuilding of the soul of learning and seek out the reverted road of the soul.
sentences.chinese: 論文最後，大聲疾呼要重建學魂並探求學魂復歸之路。

sentences.english: She would behave normally, I would behave normally, and everything would be normal again.
sentences.chinese: 她會表現正常，我會舉止得體，一切都又會復歸平常。

sentences.english: The Imperial Granary edition The Peony Pavilion offers a concept of returning to the original state of Kunqu Opera.
sentences.chinese: 皇家糧倉版《牡丹亭》以復歸崑曲肇始狀態的理念。

sentences.english: If he dies without leaving an heir, his lands will revert to the state.
sentences.chinese: 如果他死後無繼承人，其土地將復歸國家所有。

definition: to ebb and rise/to decrease and then grow
that being the case/then/in that case
variant of 輾轉|辗转[zhan3 zhuan3]
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
